title: Elie to St Monans and Pittenweem Coastal Walk Route

nearby.description: St Andrews to Anstruther Coastal Walk
Lower Largo to Shell Bay and Elie Coastal Walk

images.title: James Allan / Elie Harbour
images.caption: Elie Harbour. The prominent building at the harbour, a former granary, is now residential accommodation.

images.title: Snaik / The Light at Elie Ness
images.caption: The Light at Elie Ness

images.title: Anne Burgess / Beach west of Lady's Tower
images.caption: Beach west of Lady's Tower. A wave-cut platform below Sanger Point. The Isle of May is visible on the horizon.

images.title: Jim Bain / Watch tower Sauchar Point
images.caption: Watch tower Sauchar Point. Another view of the tower from near the low water mark or at least as near as I was going to go with a camera. St Monans in the far distance.

images.title: Paul Taylor / Ardross Castle
images.caption: Ardross Castle. Fife Coastal Path passes through the ruins of this 14th century ruined castle.

images.title: Jim Bain / St Monans
images.caption: St Monans. The west end of the village and the Parish Kirk.

images.title: Jim Bain / Old seawater evaporation building and windmill
images.caption: Old seawater evaporation building and windmill. A very old industrial site now gone back to nature. The windmill was used to draw seawater from the foreshore up into tanks housed in buildings like the one in the foreground. Coal fires fueld from local fields were then lit under the tanks and over time the water was evaporated off leaving the salt. Salt was an important preservative agent right up into the 1900's.

images.title: Jim Bain / Pittenweem
images.caption: Pittenweem. Taken from the outer harbour wall. The coastline around here is a conservation area and with fine buildings like these you can see why.

description: This walk follows a section of the epic Fife Coastal Path from Elie to St Monans and Pittenweem. It's about a 4 mile walk along a fairly flat trail, passing several sites of historic interest on the way. The walk starts from Elie Harbour and follows the waymarked trail east past Elie Ness Lighthouse, Sauchar Point and Lady's Tower. The route then passes a dismantled tower before coming to the ruins of the 14th century Ardross Castle. The route continues to St Monan's passing the old chapel on the way. You then pass the pretty harbour and windmill before the final section takes you into Pittenweem. In the historic fishing village there's an artisan chocolatiers, 17th century buildings, fine shops, galleries and the ancient St Fillan's Cave to see.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: To extend the walk you can pick up the St Andrews to Anstruther Coastal Walk and the Pittenweem to Anstruther Coastal Path. In St Andrews there's the popular Craigtoun Country Park. Here you can visit the nature trail, Italian garden, greenhouses, formal gardens, miniature railway and the large pond. The waterside trails at Cameron Reservoir are also not too far away. Heading west will take you to Lower Largo and Shell Bay. The delightful bay and the ancient fishing village are well worth exploring. Alexander Selkirk the prototype for Defoe's fictional Robinson Crusoe was born in Lower Largo in 1676. There is a statue dedicated to him in the village. Just to the north of Elie there's the pretty Kilconquhar Loch where you look out for lots of wildlife on the water.

display_address: The Toft, Elie, Elie and Earlsferry, Fife, Alba / Scotland, KY9 1EE, United Kingdom
